text.section:
As used in KRS 211.005 to 211.380, unless the context requires otherwise:
"Cabinet" means the Cabinet for Health and Family Services;
"Farmstead" means a farm dwelling, together with other farm buildings and structures incident to the operation and maintenance of the farm, situated on ten (10) contiguous acres or more of land outside the corporate limits of a municipality:
Used for the production of livestock, livestock products, poultry, poultry products, dairy, dairy products, or horticulture products or for the growing of crops such as, but not limited to, tobacco, corn, soybeans, and wheat; or
Where devoted to and meeting the requirements and qualifications for payments pursuant to agriculture programs under an agreement with the state or federal government;
"Secretary" means the secretary of the Cabinet for Health and Family Services; and
"Private water supply" means a residential water supply located on private property under the control of a person holding a possessory interest in the property, the use of which is limited to family members.

law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 338, effective June 20, 2005. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 282, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 216, sec. 1, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 482, sec. 17, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 108, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 63, sec. 1. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. VI, sec. 62. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 157, sec. 2.
